name: Homemade Ice Cream
directions: 1. Mix and refrigerate for 1-2 hours.
2. Put chilled mixture in ice cream maker for 15-25 minutes
3. Add mix-ins of choosing.

name: Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
directions: 1. Heat oven to 350 degrees.
2. Melt butter until warm, not hot.
3. Mix flour, salt, baking soda together in medium bowl; set aside.
4. Beat butters & sugars until thoroughly blended. Mix in egg, yold, and vanilla. Add dry ingredients; mix well until combined.
5. Stir in chocolate chips. Scoop into balls and bake for 9-12 minutes.

name: The Best Buttercream Frosting
directions: 1. Add softened butter and vanilla to the mixing bowl and mix until completely combinded.
2. Add powdered sugar ad beat on low until it is incorporated. Then move mixer up to medium high speed. Scrape sides and bottom of bowl often. When completely mixed the frosting may appear dry.
3. Add milk a little bit at a time until frosting is proper consistency.

name: French Crepes
directions: 1. Mix all ingredients.
2. Cook for about 1 minute on each side in crepe pan.
3. Add desired toppings.

name: Homemade Donuts
directions: 1. Mix cinnamon and sugar in a bowl. Set aside for later.
2. Use small round cookie cutter to make holes in center of biscuit dough.
3. Pour a little less than 1/2 inch of oil into cooking skillet.
5. Heat oil for 5 minutes. Fry donuts in batches of 2-3 at a time. Each side will only take 1 minute before you need to turn them over.
6. Place on paper towels when done. After cooling, dip each side of the donut in your cinnamon-suage mixture.

name: Brownies
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 325Â°F. Lightly spray an 8x8 baking dish (not a 9x9 dish or your brownies will overcook) with cooking spray and line it with parchment paper. Spray the parchment paper.
2. In a medium bowl, combine the sugar, flour, cocoa powder, powdered sugar, chocolate chips, and salt.
3. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, olive oil, water, and vanilla.
4. Sprinkle the dry mix over the wet mix and stir until just combined.

5.Pour the batter into the prepared pan (it'll be thick - that's ok) and use a spatula to smooth the top. Bake for 40 to 48 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out with only a few crumbs attached (note: it's better to pull the brownies out early than to leave them in too long). Cool completely before slicing.*** Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days. These also freeze well!
